description: One of the easiest houseplants to grow, this tropical vine comes in a variety of foliage colors and patterns. Pothos can be trimmed and kept compact, allowed to trail from hanging baskets, or trained up vertical supports.
water: Allow the top inch of soil to dry out between watering
light: Bright indirect light preferred, but tolerates low light

description: Another very easy-to-grow houseplant, similar to pothos. Foliage comes in a variety of sizes, shapes, and colors. Can also be grown outdoors in mild climates if kept out of direct sunlight.
water: Prefers soil thats evenly moist, but not soggy
light: Tolerates low light, but grows faster in medium to bright light

description: Also called rattlesnake plant, peacock plant, or prayer plant, this popular houseplant is grown for its beautifully variegated foliage, which comes in an assortment of vibrant patterns and colors.
water: Keep evenly moist, but not soggy. Use distilled or filtered water
light: Bright indirect light preferred, tolerates low light

description: Also known as Swiss cheese plant or split-leaf philodendron, this tropical beauty sports lush green leaves that develop deep slits or holes as they mature. These vine-like plants love to climb trees with their aerial roots.
water: Deeply water every 1 to 2 weeks, or whenever soil feels dry
light: Prefers medium light. Keep away from direct sunlight

description: How this plant got its name is obvious by the distinctive shape of its pointed leaves, which display a wide array of different color variations and patterns. As the plant matures, it develops a vining habit.
water: Keep soil evenly moist but not soggy
light: Prefers bright indirect light, adapts to low light

description: This elegant vase-shaped fern makes a stunning centerpiece for a table or plant stand, with fronds unfurling from a central rosette that resembles a bird's nest.
water: Keep soil evenly moist. Mist leaves occasionally
light: Indirect filtered light. Keep away from harsh sunlight

description: This fern thrives in high humidity environments. The distinctive blue-green fronds make it a beautiful addition to any indoor space.
water: Keep soil evenly moist, don't let it dry out completely
light: Moderate filtered light, no direct sunlight

description: Named for the intricate veins running through its foliage, this charming houseplant is ideal for brightening up small containers and terrariums. The leaves come in many different color combinations.
water: Water when soil surface begins to feel dry
light: Low to moderate indirect light

description: Also called Zanzibar gem because of its African origin. ZZ plant is prized for its stunning foliage, which is so green and glossy it almost looks polished. Great for neglectful owners.
water: Every 2 weeks or when top inch of soil feels dry
light: Adapts to low light, prefers medium to bright indirect light

description: Also known as Neanthe bella palm, this Central American native became popular during the Victorian era. The graceful shape and dense foliage make it a beautiful architectural accent.
water: Keep soil evenly moist. Mist leaves occasionally
light: Moderate light, no direct sunlight

description: Usually grown for its showy white flowers, the peace lily is particularly attractive with glossy green leaves. It's one of the best houseplants for improving indoor air quality.
water: Keep soil evenly moist. Leaves will droop when thirsty
light: Low to medium indirect light

description: A plant you can grow almost anywhere because it adapts to a wide range of indoor growing conditions. Most varieties have lush green leaves attractively patterned with silver, pink or red.
water: Keep soil evenly moist, but not soggy
light: Low light sufficient. Never place in direct sunlight

description: Few plants tolerate poor light levels better than this one. Named for its tough-as-nails constitution, it can withstand almost any type of abuse, except overwatering.
water: Water moderately. Allow soil to dry between watering
light: Moderate to shady. Ideal for dimly lit rooms

description: Grown for its striking variegated foliage, this highly adaptable houseplant can tolerate a wide range of light conditions. Keep out of reach of pets and children due to toxicity.
water: Water when soil feels dry to a depth of 1 inch
light: Tolerates lower light, prefers bright indirect light

description: Topped by a cluster of long, narrow leaves that sprout from the trunk like a ponytail. The fat base acts as a water reservoir, allowing it to go for weeks without a drink.
size: Very slow growing, can reach 6 feet or taller
water: Every 3 to 4 weeks, or when top 2-3 inches feels dry
light: Prefers medium to bright indirect light

description: Cute and compact, this slow-growing succulent forms attractive rosettes of fleshy green leaves accented by bands of pebbly white speckles. Ideal for terrariums.
water: Allow soil to dry out completely between watering
light: Tolerates low light, prefers moderate to bright indirect light

description: Perhaps no houseplant offers a greater array of foliage colors, textures, and shapes. Most varieties are small in size, making them ideally suited for shelves and windowsills.
water: Every 7 to 10 days, or when top inch feels dry
light: Tolerates low light, best color in bright indirect light

description: One of the most popular houseplants around. Tolerates poor light and neglect, but thrives in good conditions, producing offshoots that can easily be propagated. Effective air purifier.
water: Water when top inch of soil feels dry
light: Tolerates poor light, prefers moderate indirect light

description: Similar to cast iron plant in its ability to survive almost anything, including low light levels and drought. The snakeskin-like foliage is typically flat or slightly concave.
water: Once every week or two, or whenever soil feels dry
light: Thrives in everything from bright light to dimly lit corners

description: Especially forgiving of low light and challenging indoor conditions. Beautiful houseplants with handsome sword-shaped foliage in a wide array of solid and variegated colors.
water: Water once a week, or when surface feels dry
light: Tolerates low light, grows best in medium to bright indirect

description: Also called painted-leaf begonias, these showy houseplants are grown for their fancy foliage in spectacular array of shapes, colors, and textures, including spiral-shaped leaves.
water: Let soil approach dryness before watering thoroughly
light: Tolerates low light, grows best with brighter indirect light

description: A cactus that doesn't need bright sunlight and actually prefers darkness when setting buds for its beautiful winter-blooming flowers. Long-lived and easy to care for.
size: 6 to 12 inches tall, spreads up to 2 feet
water: Water only when top inch or two feels dry
light: Tolerates low light, prefers bright but indirect light

description: Instantly recognizable by its arching fronds of feathery foliage. Looks gorgeous displayed on a pedestal or spilling from a hanging basket. Loves humidity.
water: Keep soil evenly moist. Mist regularly
light: Tolerates low light, ideal for moderate to bright light

description: Sometimes called dwarf umbrella tree because the palmate leaves spread out like umbrella ribs. Deep green and glossy leaves, with newer cultivars adorned with gold or cream.
water: Water thoroughly, wait until soil is nearly dry before watering again
light: Tolerates low light, prefers bright indirect light
